page.title: 03RELIGION
page.content: The Priory Church The Church was built by William of Edington, Bishop of Winchester, during the period 1352-61, on the site of an earlier smaller place of worship.It was originally part of the monastry of Bonhommes monks, who led a life of preaching in the area.As fish was needed every Friday,they built a large lake, which is still there today. During history, two stories have been handed down.William Ayscough,Bishop of Salisbury,took sanctuary in the Church in 1450 but a mob from West Ashton dragged him out and murdered him on the hill.Lady Ann Beauchamp's husband died in 1630 and as she worshipped in the Church for over 30 years she had a monument erected in the building for her husband and herself.The Church holds 400 people and there have been 46 vicars since 1361.
